etymologies: Middle English: from Old French tigre, from Latin tigris, from Greek

definitions: a very large solitary cat with a yellow-brown coat striped with black, native to the forests of Asia but becoming increasingly rare.
shortDefinitions: very large solitary cat with yellow-brown coat striped with black, native to forests of Asia but becoming increasingly rare

definitions: used to refer to someone fierce, determined, or ambitious

examples.text: despite his wound, he still fought like a tiger
one of the sport's young tigers

shortDefinitions: used to refer to someone fierce or ambitious

definitions: a dynamic economy of one of the smaller eastern Asian countries, especially that of Singapore, Taiwan, or South Korea.
shortDefinitions: dynamic economy of one of smaller eastern Asian countries

phrases.text: have a tiger by the tail
